잼이따

I love this game. It is really fun to play but there are some things you should know.

The matchmaking system is very broken and unforgiving. New players will struggle to learn the many perks, systems and just the overall game play flow. The concept is simple. The practice is not.

The community is very toxic. Whether you read the endgame chat or not there will be people acting toxic in game. This can impact your experience with the game, but most people can move past it fairly easily, even if at the moment its really annoying.

There are many dlc's, which can be annoying if you dont want to spend a lot of money on the game. While you can unlock new survivors and killers with an in-game currency, the Licenced killers and survivors you have to buy with real money to get, if you want them. I have spent alot of money on this game, and some people might not want to. 

While it seems like im complaining, its more just the way of the game. It has problems, but I still enjoy it. If you find the right community, you can enjoy yourself a lot more. It's a great game, and i suggest giving it a try.

[h1]Don't buy.[/h1]

I don't usually leave in-depth reviews but DbD is a game I've put a lot of time into. Please consider reading if you're thinking about purchasing the game.

[h2]Before the Review[/h2]

Despite the time I have poured into this game, I cannot recommend it. Most of my complaints are centered around the community of the game, so if you are intending to play with friends, a lot of my complaints won’t be as relevant. I play almost exclusively solo (mostly as killer), so take that into consideration.

[h1]The Good[/h1]

1. Most of the gameplay revolves around outsmarting your opponent. The feeling you get mindgaming/predicting someone is an unparalleled, incredible feeling.

2. Toxic players are unfortunately extremely common. Beating them is a very good feeling.

3. Any time you get bored of one role, you can just play the other. Makes the game more addicting.

4. Unless you’re a higher-rated player, there is a lot of potential for build variety. There are a lot of perks you can equip. A LOT of perks.

[h3]Killer[/h3]

1. Gameplay is intense and has absolutely zero downtime. You are always doing something, and every move you make must have intention behind it. Performing well (in the right circumstances) feels intensely rewarding.

2. Playing recklessly has visible consequences, and errors [i]really[/i], [i]really[/i] make you feel like you messed up. Because mistakes are extremely punishing, it feels great to improve. Every game you play, you feel like you learned something. And there’s always more to learn, no matter how many hours you dedicate.

3. It’s satisfying to damage survivors. Not really much else to be said about that, it just feels nice.

4. Killers have a lot of variety. If you’re ever bored of a certain killer, you can always just play a different one. Playstyles feel fairly unique.

[h3]Survivor[/h3]

I don’t really have as much to say as Killer because I don’t play Survivor as much.

1. Gameplay is, weirdly enough, pretty laid-back and relaxing. Hold M1 on a generator all game unless you get chased, enjoy the intense moments of trying to out-smart each other, then go back to chilling.

2. Asserting your dominance over someone that is supposed to be stronger than you is very satisfying.

3. Playing with friends is fun. If you’re playing seriously, communicating information with your teammates feels similar to a competitive game, with constant callouts.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]

:(

[h3]Rulebook[/h3]

Dead by Daylight relies on players’ good behavior for balance. This means that you are expected to follow an unspoken rulebook, which some people choose to not obey. This means that you can either choose to handicap yourself for the sake of keeping the game healthy, while others don’t (putting you at a disadvantage), or you can ignore it and nobody but you will enjoy the experience.

Everyone, no matter their side, will ignore elements of the rulebook that are convenient, and follow ones they can manage. As a result, nobody is ever happy, everyone is always angry, and everyone has very unrealistic expectations for matches.

[h3]RNG[/h3]

Many elements of the game are random-chance. Offerings, map, who has what perks/items, the killer, etc. While this is great for keeping the game interesting, it means that you can’t prepare for any unfair situations. It’s not a huge deal, unless you take the game seriously, but it still never feels good to lose to something you were helpless against.

[h3]Horrible Developers & Design Decisions[/h3]

Holy Lord. There are too many examples to count, so I encourage you to research this yourself. Just watch basically any Scott Jund video on YouTube pre-Elden Ring to get a quick summary of community reactions to patches.

In summary, the developers are unfathomably incompetent, almost in an entertaining way. Watching Q&As and their thoughts on issues with the game is hilarious until you play the game.

[h3]Competition / Meta[/h3]

This game is the last game people should be taking seriously. This game is completely, undeniably unfit for competitive play. Despite this, everyone mid-high rank thinks otherwise.

Players that are under the false impression the game is competitively viable are consistently unbearable. They suck to play with and against. They complain non-stop, blame everyone but themselves, use nothing but meta, and act generally obnoxious. This would normally not be a problem I address in games, because they’re generally avoidable, but there are a lot of players like this. A lot. Mid-high rank you should expect to have at least one player like this every game.

Even when taking this game seriously, meta and sweaty playstyles are very, very, very unfun. Using the same 4 perks is not enjoyable. Playing the exact same way every game for hundreds of hours is not enjoyable. Playing this game to win is not enjoyable. Expecting consistency out of a game like this is asking for disappointment.

Because of the MMR system, you are given tougher matches every time you perform well. For winning, your reward is the unbearable soul-sucking tedium of sweaty games.

As a killer, not only are you encouraged to neuter yourself so that the game lasts long enough to get points, but you’re encouraged to lose so that you can keep using fun builds/having fun/etc.

Despite your role, since meta is SIGNIFICANTLY stronger than any alternative, you are forced to use it if you want to compete higher-rank. No matter your playstyle. Playing is always a losing battle.

[h3]Bugs[/h3]

The game is always a buggy mess. Most infamous example that comes to memory is the release of the “A Binding of Kin” DLC. Releases such as this are very common.

[h3]Community[/h3]

The community is one of the, if not the most toxic game community I have ever witnessed. Due to the horrible state the game is always in, the game practically breeds toxicity. Even if you don’t intend to be, the game relentlessly begs you to be unhappy and angry.

[h3]Role Skill Imbalance and Killers[/h3]

This is going to sound like a salty killer main venting. That's because it is. Killer, at least at the time of writing this, feels absolutely horrible to play for a lot of reasons. One of these reasons, is the different objectives each role needs to complete.

Survivor mains would disagree with this (because why wouldn't they), but survivor is objectively easier. Killer has to constantly act with intention and is completely alone. Survivor spends most of the game standing still holding a button, and has three other people that can take chases, the only skillful element of survivor.

Obviously chases are still skillful as survivor, but generally gameplay is significantly easier. This inflates the egos of a lot of survivors, even if they didn't accomplish anything. This, coupled with second-chance perks that require minimal input, make it very frustrating to lose time against. 'Losing' chases as killer feels horrible a lot of the time, because you are having to keep track of a large amount of info and risking time-loss for chases. Even if the survivors were to repeatedly lose chases instantly, that doesn't make any significant impact on the game. Survivors that are good at positioning and tackling the right generators can win even if the killer ends every chase quickly.

Killer and survivor have different objectives. Survivors' objective is easier, the team size is larger, and there are many "get out of jail free" cards.

As a result, survivor queue times are excruciatingly long. The only killer players remaining are just playing to ruin survivors' time. Unfun for everyone.

[h3]. . .[/h3]

I could keep going on but complaining about it is getting exhausting. You get the idea.

[h1]Closing[/h1]

Don’t get the game. It’s addicting, but not worth your time. Playing feels like constantly chasing a high.

I wish this game was fun so, so bad. Play Video Horror Society instead.

很有趣的游戏模式，农场主和四个偷电贼的较量十分精彩。如果没有那么多“错误”和BUG，并加入好友观战系统，回放录像功能，游戏历史查询功能，并显著提高作弊封禁速率，缩短简化举报流程。我相信游戏会更加友好，热度也会上升。
